intro: Octomeria decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
